content.text:
Since the second conditional deals with an unreal situation, we usually use the "were" form of the verb to be instead of the "was" form, even if we are speaking in the first or third person singular:

-If I were less worried about the future, I'd enjoy life more.
-If he were more careful, he wouldn't make so many mistakes.

This is the subjunctive mood in English, which is used here because it deals with situations that are not real.
